result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Adam N Didier in court with attorney Daryl W Laatsch.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss but read-in; so ordered.

Defendant Adam N Didier in court with attorney Daryl W Laatsch.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called with 15CF1. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 09:15 am.
From defendant requesting modification of bail. Scanned/Forwarded to Branch 2.
9/28/2015 Hearing    Paper exhibits destroyed as of 07/05/2018.

Defendant Adam N Didier in court with attorney Daryl W Laatsch.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State requests court to take judicial notice of 15CF1 record. M.M. sworn and testifies. Witness excused. State requests court find probable cause. Atty Laatsch addresses court. Court finds probable cause and binds case over for trial. State files information. Defense waives reading and enters plea of not guilty. Atty Laatsch requests modification of bail. State objects. Court denies modification of bail.  Further proceedings scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 09:30 am.
w/condition: absolute sobriety, continue on scram if released from custody.

Branch 1 hearing for Branch 2 for purposes of bail only / Defendant Adam N Didier in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court is informed defendant qualifies for the public defender, has Atty. Darryl Laatsch on another criminal case pending. There is a probation hold on defendant.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing w/in 10 days. State recommends additional $2500 cash bail. Court orders cash bail of $5000 w/conditions.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Per Dispatch, subject is in custody on warrant
